name: Commemoration of Oscar II's 25th Wedding Anniversary
obverse: Heads of King Oscar II and Queen Sophia in medallions facing each other. Below the medallions is a flower and four buds (representing the four sons of the king and queen). Above the medallions is a crown and laurel.
reverse: Neptune holding his trident standing on a dolphin. Behind Neptune are water plants. Around the scene is a doubled rope. At the bottom below the rope is an anchor.
reverse_inscriptions: SOCIETAS NEPTUN. REGI ET REGINÆ D. NUPT. XXV CELEBRANTIBUS PIE GRATULATUR.
description: This medal was made to commemorate the 25th Wedding Anniversary between king Oscar II and Queen Sophia.
This medal was commissioned by the Order of Neptune.
